alert.note: Alert for Antelope Valley; Lake Casitas; Los Angeles County Beaches; Ojai Valley; Santa Barbara County Interior Mountains; Santa Ynez Mountains Eastern Range; Ventura County Beaches; Ventura County Inland Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 19 at 6:05AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: * WHAT...A Flood Watch is in effect for Sunday afternoon through Monday evening. Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Los Angeles and Ventura Counties and the Santa Barbara County Interior Mountains. * WHEN...A Flood Watch is in effect for Sunday afternoon through Monday evening. Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... -Tropical system Hilary will move over southern California and bring the potential for heavy rain and thunderstorms. -http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
